=Examples of Darwin Core as RDF using Darwin-SW object properties=

*Date:* (Created) 27 June 2013; (Last modified) 30 June 2013

*Status:* Not part of any standard ([http://www.tdwg.org/standards/147/ Type 3] document); intended to complement the RDF Guide of the Darwin Core Standard ([http://www.tdwg.org/standards/450/])

*Permanent URL:* http://

*TDWG Task Group:* [http://code.google.com/p/tdwg-rdf/ TDWG RDF/OWL Task Group]

*Contributors:* [mailto:steve.baskauf@vanderbilt.edu?subject=RDFguide Steve Baskauf] (TDWG RDF/OWL Task Group)

*Abstract:* These examples follow the Darwin Core RDF Guide. They assume the data model of the TaxonConcept Ontology (http://www.taxonconcept.org/ ) and use its object properties to link the class instances.  See http://code.google.com/p/tdwg-rdf/wiki/BiodiversityOntologies for a comparison of some data models that provide object terms that can be used with Darwin Core.
